page.title: 07PUBLIC HOUSES, BURSTON AREA
page.content:
The only amenities in this area for relaxation are the two Public Houses. The first, The Red Lion, is on the B5027 road near the village of Milwich. At first sight it is easily mistaken for a farm and visitors have trouble finding the way in. It is very quiet and uncommercialised and used almost entirely by local people. Its facilities are basic with tiled floors, wooden chairs and an open fire.
The Greyhound, just off the A5l, in Burston itself, is well signposted and unmistakably a Public House. It is popular with people from a wide area including Stone and tourists from the canal, who go to eat and drink in comfortable surroundings and a friendly atmosphere.
